thread.title: HAN on Demand: Ram cross country rules on Senior Day
thread.title_full: HAN on Demand: Ram cross country rules on Senior Day

author: Dave Stewart
title: HAN on Demand: Ram cross country rules on Senior Day
text:
By Dave Stewart on October 14, 2015 in FCIAC , High School Sports , Sports , Sports Lead · 0 Comments 
New Canaan was dominant in its final cross country meet of the regular season on Tuesday, as both the boys and girls teams swept through four opponents in Waveny Park. The Rams finished in a pack at the top of the varsity races, with the girls taking the top 14 spots and the boys taking the top four and 12 of the top 13 places. Junior Drew Davis won the girls 4K race, with sophomore Cali Brannan second and senior Amanda Dobbin third, while junior Michael St. George finished first in the boys 5K race, with senior Aidan Buck second and sophomore Alex Urbahn third. The meet was carried live by the HAN Network and featured interviews with the top three finishers in each varsity race. New Canaan’s Drew Davis reaches the finish line during the girls varsity 4K race Tuesday in Waveny Park. — Kate Czaplinski photo The strong finish was a great launching pad into the postseason, which begins with the FCIAC championships in Waveny Park next Wednesday. The meet, which starts at 1:30 p.m., will be carried live on all of the HAN Network’s sites, including live.han.network, NCAdvertiser.com, and FCIAC.net. The Rams were also celebrating Senior Day on Tuesday, honoring the 12th-graders who are in their final run-through with the team, including co-captains Dobbin and Lindsey Miller for the girls and Buck, Ryan McGough and Patrick Blasco for the boys. Davis, Brannan and Dobbin were runnig together for much of the race before separating on the final incline. Davis showed a tremendous kick and won in 16:27, with Brannan (16:33) and Dobbin (16:47) close behind. Junior Lauren Carlson (4th, 17:27) and sophomore Leigh Charlton (5th, 17:29) rounded out the scoring for New Canaan. Also in the top 10 were Miller (6th, 17:31), sophomore Chloe McAuliffe (7th, 17:33), and juniors Megan Waldron (8th, 17:40), Anne Greer (11th, 17:47), and Annalee Greenspon (10th, 18:23). New Canaan’s Michael St. George takes first place in the boys varsity 5K race. — Kate Czaplinski photo In the boys race, St. George had the lead for much of the way and won in 17:47, with Buck closing on the final hill and finishing second in 17:52. Urbahn was third in 18:07, a step ahead of McGough, who took fourth at 18:08. Westhill junior Joshua Mensah was fifth in 18:18 to break up the all-New Canaan party at the top. The Rams, however, had the next three finishers, including juniors Fausto Cortina (6th, 18:26) and Jake Grigsby (7th, 18:27), and sophomore Henry Asker (8th, 18:35). Also in the top 12 for New Canaan were seniors Chris Roman (10th, 18:50) and Jack O’Connor (11th, 18:53), and sophomore Alex Orwicz (12th, 19:00).
